figcaption.p: The District 205 Foundation has established a Community Response Fund to support families during this closure. Click here for more information and to donate.
For District 205's latest communication on COVID-19, click here.

Congratulations to York senior Jack Schiltz for being awarded the National Marine ROTC Scholarship! The ROTC Scholarship is a full tuition, four-year scholarship that required a lengthy application process. Jack plans to attend Purdue University next year. Congratulations on this honor, Jack!
Students in York's Business Incubator program present their business models to an Advisory Board.

div.p: Elmhurst Community Unit School District 205 is a national leader in future-ready learning. The District currently serves more than 8,000 students who reside primarily in the City of Elmhurst and small portions of Oak Brook, Bensenville and Addison.

div.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsList district-news fsThumbnailOriginal fsThumbnailSmall fsItemCount_5

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-3 fsTag-2 fsTag-3 fsTag-4 fsTag-5 fsTag-39 fsTag-72 fsTag-73 fsTag-74 fsTag-75 fsTag-76 fsTag-77 fsTag-78 fsTag-79

div.p: This afternoon, Illinois Governor J.B. Pritzker issued a statement in which he suspended in-person learning for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. At the April 28th Elmhurst Community Unit School District 205 Board of Education meeting, the administration will present the board of education with options to consider for how District 205 moves forward with upcoming events such as graduation and summer school.

div.a: Governor J.B. Pritzker extends school closures through the end of the school year

div.p: Illinois Governor J.B. Pritzker has announced that school closures will extend through the end of the 2019-2020 school year. Schools will continue to provide instruction through remote learning. We realize a decision of this magnitude elicits many questions and concerns. D205 Superintendent Dr. David Moyer will address the closure extension in a letter to families and staff later this evening.

div.a: Those Who Excel Nominations Now Open

div.p: Illinois Teacher of the Year and Those Who Excel are state-wide programs conducted by the Illinois State Board of Education (ISBE). By nominating people for recognition, you call to public attention some of our outstanding staff members and volunteers and show these exemplary people how much their efforts are valued and appreciated. We suggest you not tell your nominee(s) about being nominated until they emerge as the District nominee in one of the seven categories.

We're calling all residents to get creative! Send us your pictures and videos on how you and your families are staying positive and having fun through the State's "Stay at Home Order". We will collect this content through the month of April, and feature it on our website and social pages. Some of the submissions may also make a debut in the next City of Elmhurst Front Porch Newsletter.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-3 fsTag-2 fsTag-3 fsTag-4 fsTag-5 fsTag-39 fsTag-72 fsTag-73 fsTag-74 fsTag-75 fsTag-76 fsTag-77 fsTag-78 fsTag-79

p.font: D205 has been in regular communication with government and health officials. This afternoon, Illinois Governor J.B. Pritzker announced a decision to extend statewide school closures and the “Stay at Home” order until April 30, 2020.

The extension follows updated guidance from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and an announcement from the White House extending physical distancing guidelines until April 30, 2020.
D205 Superintendent Dr. David Moyer is examining the decision and will share how this impacts district-wide plans beyond our current closure as soon as possible.

div.div: Students involved in an extracurricular activity or athletics at York High School
referendum approved in 2018 to build two new schools, improve safety and security, provide the space for all-day kindergarten, and add future ready learning spaces at all schools.
new Manufacturing Program and Business Incubator lab opens at York High School
sports programs, both cut and non-cut, offered to students each season

div.p: The mission of Elmhurst Community Unit School District 205 is to meet the educational needs of all students, challenging each to his or her full potential and ensuring a foundation for future success in life.

Elmhurst Community Unit School District 205 will be a national leader in educating children of all backgrounds and ability levels, promoting high individual student achievement. The District will incorporate student-centered decision making, the highest academic standards, best practices in education, the highest caliber educational professionals, and leading edge resources to ensure an equitable education for all and success in a global society.
